Classes/Domain.html.name: Domain
Classes/Domain.html.abstract: A Domain instance contains an elliptic curve domain - either with characteristic 2 or characteristic an odd prime.

Classes/CipherSuite.html.name: CipherSuite
Classes/CipherSuite.html.abstract: A CipherSuite instance is a HPKE element consisting of a Key Encapsulation Mechanism (KEM), a Key Derivation Function (KDF)

Classes/HPKEPrivateKey.html.name: HPKEPrivateKey
Classes/HPKEPrivateKey.html.abstract: A HPKE private key. There are five different private keys types corresponding to the five KEM’s

Classes/HPKEPublicKey.html.name: HPKEPublicKey
Classes/HPKEPublicKey.html.abstract: A public key. There are five different public keys types corresponding to the five KEM’s

Classes/Recipient.html.name: Recipient
Classes/Recipient.html.abstract: Based on its CipherSuite, a Recipient instance can decrypt a sequence of messages in one of four modes:

Classes/Sender.html.name: Sender
Classes/Sender.html.abstract: Based on its CipherSuite, a Sender instance can encrypt a sequence of messages in one of four modes:

Classes/ECSignature.html.name: ECSignature
Classes/ECSignature.html.abstract: ECSignature instances contain an ECDSA signature which consists of two byte arrays named r and s

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
